cheatsheet.title: Selecting nodes from trees in GUIdancer

intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to use GUIdancer to select a node in a tree. When you select a node, the tree is automatically "expanded" to the node.

item.title: Create a Test Case
item.description:
Create a Test Case called Select node from tree.
Open the Test Case Editor for this Test Case.

item.title: Reference a Test Case to select a node from a tree
item.description:
From the unbound modules, browse to the category:
Actions (basic) > Select > Tree.

subitem.label: Select the Test Case "ub_tre_selectNode_byTextpath". Drag it into the Test Case Editor so that it appears under the "Select node from tree" Test Case.

item.title: Enter the parameter details for the Test Case
item.description: This Test Case has seven parameters, which you can see in the properties view.

subitem.label: The "path type" parameter lets you specify whether the path you enter is relative to the current position or absolute (i.e. for the whole tree). In the "path type" parameter field, enter: absolute

The "pre-ascend" parameter is important when you are using relative paths in a tree, to specify how many levels to go up before starting the search for the node. In the "pre-ascend" parameter field, enter: 0
In the "Textpath" parameter field, enter: Category.*/Horror.*
In the "Operator" parameter field, enter: matches

The "number of clicks" parameter lets you define how often to click on the node to select it. Entering 0 means that the mouse just hovers over the node. In the "number of clicks" parameter field, enter: 1
In the "Mouse Button" parameter field, enter: 1. This means that the selection will be done with the left mouse button.
In the "Extend Selection" parameter field, enter: no. The extend selection parameter is to allow multi-selection, which is not required here.

item.title: Give the component a meaningful component name
item.description:
In the Test Case Editor, select the
ub_tre_selectNode_byTextpath Test Case.

subitem.label: In the component names view, in the "new name" field, enter "DVDTool_Category_tree" as the new component name.
Save the Test Case Editor. You now have a Test Case which will select "Category > Horror" from a tree in your application.

item.title: Execute the test
item.description:
Try this Test Case out on the DVD Tool. You will need to create a Test Suite, and add this Test Case to it. You may also need to select the AUT you want to use in the Properties View for the Test Suite Editor.
You will need to carry out object mapping, and you must (manually) create a new category called Horror in the DVD tool for the test to work.
